author: dlr
msg: Added a (currently failing) test case for issue 2306, "'switch' does
not reset the native file system's read-only attribute within a WC".
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/switch_tests.py
(refresh_read_only_attribute): A new test case which (1) tests that
a WC file's read-only flag (on the native FS) is set after being
locked and (2) tests that the read-only flag is cleared after
switching the WC back to a branch on which the file is not locked.
(test_list): Added refresh_read_only_attribute XFail to the end of
the list.  This test never passed on Windows, but I believe it
passed on Linux before the merge of the wc-replacements branch.

author: dlr
msg: Merge r17082, fixing the atexit handler in Python bindings to only
destroy the application pool if it is still valid.
Approved by: djames, dlr

author: dlr
msg: * STATUS: Vote for r17082 (approving).

author: djames
msg: * STATUS: Nominate and vote for r17082. Tweak formatting.

author: djames
msg: Fix atexit handler to only destroy the application pool if it is a valid
application pool still exists.
Patch by: Andre Malo <nd@perlig.de>
(Tweaked by me to use the _cleanup_application_pool function.)
* subversion/bindings/swig/python/svn/core.py
(_cleanup_application_pool): New function. Destroy application pool if
it is still valid.
(): Use _cleanup_application_pool function in atexit handler.
